balanceOf(address,uint256).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOf}. Requirements: - `account` cannot be the zero address.

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOfBatch}. Requirements: - `accounts` and `ids` must have the same length.

returns._0: The address of the bridge contract

params.amount: The amount of tokens to be burnt
params.from: The account holding tokens to be burnt

params.amounts: The array of amounts of tokens to be burnt
params.from: The account holding tokens to be burnt
params.ids: The array of token type IDs

constructor.details: Creates an "empty" template token that will be cloned in the future

initialize(string,address).details: Upgrades an "empty" template. Initializes internal variables.

params.bridge_: The address of the bridge of the tokens

params.amount: The amount of tokens to be minted
params.id: The ID of the token type

params.amounts: The array of amount of tokens of each token type
params.ids: The array of token types IDs

uri(uint256).details: See {IERC1155MetadataURI-uri}. This implementation returns the concatenation of the `_baseURI` and the token-specific uri if the latter is set This enables the following behaviors: - if `_tokenURIs[tokenId]` is set, then the result is the concatenation   of `_baseURI` and `_tokenURIs[tokenId]` (keep in mind that `_baseURI`   is empty per default); - if `_tokenURIs[tokenId]` is NOT set then we fallback to `super.uri()`   which in most cases will contain `ERC1155._uri`; - if `_tokenURIs[tokenId]` is NOT set, and if the parents do not have a   uri value set, then the result is empty.

devdoc.title: A custom ERC1155 contract used in the bridge

Burn(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Is emitted on every burn of the token

BurnBatch(address,uint256[],uint256[]).notice: Is emitted on everu burn of the batch of tokens

Mint(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Is emitted on every mint of the token

MintBatch(address,uint256[],uint256[]).notice: Is emitted on every mint of batch of tokens

bridge().notice: Returns the address of the bridge contract

burn(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Destroys tokens of specific token type

burnBatch(address,uint256[],uint256[]).notice: Destroys a batch (batches) of tokens of specific type (types)

mint(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Creates amount tokens of specific type and assigns them to the user

mintBatch(address,uint256[],uint256[]).notice: Creates a batch (batches) of tokens of specific type (types) and assigns them to the user
